ldc_extent.charseq: At his retirement after 31 years in uniform, Col. Charles Hodges is being lauded as much for his accomplishments for the military outside the gates of Joint Base Lewis-McChord as for his achievements leading Stryker soldiers.
A 31-year-old man fatally shot his 35-year-old girlfriend inside her home near Puyallup and then killed himself, the Pierce County Sheriff???s Department said Monday.

A male pedestrian was taken to the hospital with life-threatening injuries Monday after he was hit about 2 p.m. crossing River Road in Puyallup, police said.
A man shot at sheriff???s deputies early Monday during a high-speed chase that ended in the parking lot of a Tacoma bowling alley, the Pierce County Sheriff???s Department said.
A body found last week on the east side of Mount Rainier was a Tacoma man who disappeared last year while hiking the Wonderland Trail with his son.

Executive Director Duke Paulson, members of the Puyallup City Council, representatives of the South Hill Rotary, state Rep. Hans Zeiger and others unveiled the new duplex near Puyallup High School during a ribbon-cutting ceremony July 28.

From the office of the Pierce County auditor, week ending July 31, 2015 Pierce County Prosecutor Mark Lindquist faces a hearing this week before petitioners who hope to recall him from office; in court briefings, he says his critics have no case Politics & Government Get daily updates about political news from the state government in Olympia as well as Pierce County, Tacoma and other local governments.

The man who fatally shot nine people during a Charleston bible study picked the wrong church to spread hate, one of the victim???s granddaughters told a crowd gathered in Tacoma Sunday.
Firefighters contained an 80-acre fire near Emerald Ridge High School, but thousands of nearby residents are still being told to be ready to leave if needed.
